intro: Solenostigma sumatranum, commonly known as the Sumatran starling plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous shrub native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Sumatra and Borneo. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small and clustered in cymes, typically displaying white or pale yellow petals. Solenostigma sumatranum is often found in humid, shaded environments within lowland forests.
